meanings.sent1: She reevaluated her decision after receiving new information.
meanings.sent2: He always reevaluated his work to make sure it was accurate.
meanings.sent3: The detective reevaluated the evidence and realized he had missed a crucial clue.
meanings.sent4: After the setback, she reevaluated her approach and came up with a better plan.
meanings.sent5: The scientist reevaluated the experiment, looking for any errors that could have affected the results.

meanings.sent1: They reevaluated their budget to see if they could afford the trip.
meanings.sent2: The committee reevaluated the proposal before making a final decision.
meanings.sent3: The teacher reevaluated the test scores and realized there was a mistake in grading.
meanings.sent4: She reevaluated her priorities and decided to focus on what truly mattered to her.
meanings.sent5: The company reevaluated its marketing strategy to reach a wider audience.
